instruction: Explain the significance of the Berlin Wall.
output: The Berlin Wall was constructed in 1961 to separate East and West Berlin. It served as a physical barrier between those living in East Germany, a country of the Soviet bloc, and West Berlin, a part of the western democracy. The Berlin Wall was meant to prevent East Germans from fleeing to the West, while also symbolizing the Cold War divisions between East and West. Its destruction in 1989 marked the beginning of the end of the Cold War.
